*div1 type="summary"* *p*Amos Edwards to Austin, September 15, 1830. Misunderstanding concerning land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Davis' Point Galveston Bay*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="09-15-1830">Sept, 15th 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p*
*p*I have just recd your letter dated *date_mentioned n="08-29-1830">29th August*/date_mentioned* by the hands of *person_mentioned*Majr Lewis*/person_mentioned*, and am very much astonished at the contents; or that part relative our conversation when you was here in *date_mentioned n="04-xx-1830">april last*/date_mentioned*— you say that agreeably to my request you have held in reserve for me *location_mentioned*the tract on the north side of Clear Creek between that creek and the red Bluff tract*/location_mentioned*— you must have misunderstood me greatly if you thought I requested you to hold that tract of land in reserve for me for I never had the most distant Idea of such a thing and it would have been base in me to have wished to have had that tract conveyed to me after having given it up to*person_mentioned* Mr Morris */person_mentioned*for whom I purchased*location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Taylor*/person_mentioned*s improvement*/location_mentioned*, which I had previously to your comeing here informed you be letter and *person_mentioned*Mr Morris*/person_mentioned* at the same thime applyed to you by letter for that tract— and he is now on it and has improved it considerably— when you was here you advised me to go and live on that *location_mentioned*tract at the mouth of Clear Creek*/location_mentioned* and gave as a reason that it would be more to my interest as this land here was poor and that is very rich— and finally said that you could not let me have both places and I might take my choice— my reply to you was that I prefered this place as health was my first object and the land was good enough for me to make a living on and just at that time *person_mentioned*Mr Perry */person_mentioned*arrivd which broke up our conversation— but several days afterwards— you returned from an excursion with *person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned* and the *person_mentioned*Surveyors*/person_mentioned*— when you again undertook to advise me to leave here and go to the*location_mentioned* mouth of Clear Creek */location_mentioned*and I made you the same reply-—that I prefered this place and was unwilling to go from it as I was satisfied that it is a healthy place and did not believe the other to be healthy—and now I know the*location_mentioned* mouth of Clear Creek */location_mentioned*is very unhealthy as almost every person who has been there this season has been and is sick— Shortly after my arrival into this Government you invited me to visit and explore your *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*before I would settle myself which I intended doing shortly after the rect of your letter but sickness prevented me then but I had fixed my mind on this place before I left *location_mentioned*Kentucky */location_mentioned*and determined on coming to it if it was unappropriated and being informed that it was vacant I applied to you by letter last *date_mentioned n="09-xx-1829">September */date_mentioned*for this place for myself and for*location_mentioned* twenty Leagues*/location_mentioned* around it upon which twenty *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*would settle as soon as they could remove after I gave them notice— your answer to me was that I could have my situation and as many *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*as removed with me could have situation but that you could give no answer as to the balance or any more lands untill the *person_mentioned*Genl. Commissioner */person_mentioned*came on who you expected shortly and would then write me fully on that subject— upon the receipt of your letter I began to prepare to remove to this place—and about the *date_mentioned n="11-1-1829">first of November*/date_mentioned* sent part of my *person_mentioned*hands */person_mentioned*and stock with *person_mentioned*Junker */person_mentioned*to come here and put me up some cabbins or camps to shelter my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*when they came on—*/p*
*p*I followed with the balance of my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*in *date_mentioned n="12-xx-1830">December */date_mentioned*except my *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*and called to see you on my way here and informed you that some of my *person_mentioned*hands */person_mentioned*were here then improving this place—You said we would not fall out about it and that I should have a place to suit me here and when you was here you told me I might have my choice of this or the*location_mentioned* Clear Creek tract*/location_mentioned* and I told you I prefered *location_mentioned*this place*/location_mentioned*, which I deemed sufficient and expected you would have had this tract surveyed for me before *person_mentioned*Mr Ingram*/person_mentioned* returned to *location_mentioned*St. Fillippe*/location_mentioned*— there were several other *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*removed with me who all intended coming near here but on their way heard that you had forbid any person setling in this part of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*they stoped above *location_mentioned*Harrisburg */location_mentioned*except *location_mentioned*Mr Morris*/location_mentioned* who came on here in *date_mentioned n="02-xx-1830">Feby*/date_mentioned*. and engaged *person_mentioned*Junker */person_mentioned*to live on the *location_mentioned*place */location_mentioned*I bought of *person_mentioned*Taylor */person_mentioned*for him untill he could bring his *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*down which he did in *date_mentioned n="07-xx-1830">July */date_mentioned*and calld to see you on his way—when he says you informed him that I had taken the *location_mentioned*tract at the mouth of clear creek*/location_mentioned* which was the reason he declined taking a certificate of his admission into the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*and was very much displeased with me untill he came and found I had not taken his place away— he wishes to become a *person_mentioned*setler */person_mentioned*provided he can get the land he is on— and if I cannot keep the tract I am on after being invited by you into your *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned* and coming here by your approbation and permission I must seek an asylum in some other *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*for I know of no other place within this that will suit me and I cannot see with what justice I am to be compelled to leave a place that I have come to setled and done a great deal of labour on before there was a compass set or a chain streched on it for any other *person_mentioned*individual */person_mentioned*in this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, or any other to occupy— and all my labour with ten *person_mentioned*hands */person_mentioned*and myself improving the place to be totally lost,— it may be law, of course it will [not] be justice, but I hope you do not think it is either to take a mans labour for nothing. I came to this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*with the hope of getting a sufficiency of land for myself and all my *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned* and to have them all settled around me, and I expected to have found in you a friend who would have aided me in accomplishing my wishes in that respect and was more encouraged to believe so after— receiving your letters and shall yet hope I am not disappointed totally untill I see you again, but see no prospect of get- ting all my *person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*to settle near me I will [try] to be at your *location_mentioned*house*/location_mentioned* about the... [mutilated] agreably to your request when I hope you [will] give me a title for this place on which I have spent a great deal of labour and money-—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Amos Edwards*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned* San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
